website_summaries.verdict: A unisex packable rain jacket that you can easily store in its pocket and take out as needed.
pros: Can fold up into its back pocket, which can be used for storage while wearing the jacket
cons: Tends to run small, so you may want to order a size up

customer_reviews.title: Sweat really bad under it
customer_reviews.text: Cheap and not breathable. Sweat really bad under it. UPDATE! I wrote my review about this product and the company contacted me wanting to know what they could do to make me happy with my purchase. They were more than gracious. Even though I was not happy with the product, they have outstanding customer service!!! Thank you! They are worth shopping with to explore other products.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie Bloom

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for active lifestyle
customer_reviews.text: I needed a raincoat for my active lifestyle. This raincoat is perfect for running during drizzle/light rain. I would get soak and wet when running outside and just wearing a sweater. Now I wear this raincoat and stay dry on top layers. I am 5’ 8” 155lbs, and a large is a perfect fit while in wearing two layers underneath. I recommend this raincoat/jacket for active lifestyles such as running.
customer_reviews.author: abe

customer_reviews.title: Wasted money is wasted money regardless of how much it ...
customer_reviews.text: This is not waterproof. I wore this 3 times in a very light rain to get to my car from my office and all three times I ended up with water spots on my clothes underneath. Wasted money is wasted money regardless of how much it is. Don't buy this jacket.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan B.

customer_reviews.title: Not water resistant
customer_reviews.text: Water gets through the jacket and will make you soaked. If you want good material / quality this is not the jacket for you.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Zirbel

customer_reviews.title: Great Rain Jacket for a Great Price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this rain jacket to include in a care package for our son who is working as a counselor at a summer camp. Shortly after it arrived he was on the trail in the mountains when they were hit by a huge rain storm. It kept him 99% dry, a little moisture may have gotten through the seams in the shoulders but he said that it wasn't a problem. He said that it's very light and packable and was so happy to have it in his pack when he needed it.
customer_reviews.author: A. Honn

customer_reviews.title: Great jacket
customer_reviews.text: I love this rain coat! I read other reviews so I knew what to expect. It is simply a plastic overcoat. It's perfect for my purposes. There IS NOT moisture wicking material inside so if you sweat, the inside gets pretty damp. I also recommend getting a larger size so you can fit another layer underneath if you're planning to wear in cold weather. This fits it's purpose for me - and if it ever breaks I will certainly get another.
customer_reviews.author: meg

customer_reviews.title: This jacket will keep you dry if you're out in ...
customer_reviews.text: This jacket will keep you dry if you're out in the rain up to about 2 hours. After that you'll begin to feel moisture on your skin. Definitely a spring/summer jacket; this thing in thin.
customer_reviews.author: V. Karpuszka

customer_reviews.title: go Ahead and burn your money before wasting on this coat
customer_reviews.text: Literally the most terrible waste of money I ever bought Rained slightly for about 6 minutes and every single drop ended up through the "waterproof" coat awful don't waste your money
customer_reviews.author: Uriah

customer_reviews.title: Water resistant for about 15 minutes of some lite rain. Any longer and you'll get wet
customer_reviews.text: I bought this with the idea that I could walk around in the rain and stay dry. Absolutely, wrong. Water seeps through and eventually your clothes get wet. On top of that the type of material its made of makes you sweat so if you don't get wet by the rain you'll get wet from your own sweat. Furthermore, it's extremely difficult to fold it back into the small pouch it comes in.
customer_reviews.author: Biko weeks

customer_reviews.title: Impressed with the quality the zippers were great
customer_reviews.text: I am 6 ft 2in. In way jacket fit good I do have longer arm length and it just barely fit but that's typical for the clothes that I wear. I wear an extra large with under armor and this fit like an under armor. Only draw back in the photos it shows a little bag that it stores into but a zip lock bag is good enough. I'm using this for running if it rains
customer_reviews.author: Savvy

customer_reviews.title: Very nice - durable and great rain cover! Looks good too!
customer_reviews.text: This rain coat is nice! My hubby loves it! It fits true to size. He's normally around a 2X, and even over a shirt, this raincoat in 2x fit true to size. It looks appealing too. The blue is very nice. He finds it to be durable and sufficient coverage from the rain! A++
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany CherryBlossom

customer_reviews.title: Great except the fit
customer_reviews.text: I really like Baleaf products and have many. They usually fit me well, but this one isn't fitted as nicely. Two main things: 1. there is a lot of extra space/fabric in the main trunk of the jacket (in other words it's like a sail - not good for aero), 2. the sleeves are too short and don't cover my wrists - where I really need it. I purchased the medium and I am between average to athletic build. It is waterproof and light.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very nice lightweight packable rain jacket
customer_reviews.text: This jacket is very nice and waterproof, I really like it for being lightweight for packing in a backpack when going hiking, biking, going to amusement parks, etc. However, after reading several reviews of people complaining about being wet inside this jacket, I want to say this, it doesn’t tell you anywhere on the labeling that you WILL sweat inside the jacket. So that’s most likely the reason why your clothes are wet while wearing the jacket. As I said, it’s a very nice jacket and everything, but the reason I rated it with 3 stars is because the hood drawstring on the right side from the wearer’s perspective broke (pulled away from its stitched in position on the collar.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry-Bee Weaver

customer_reviews.title: Great Jacket
customer_reviews.text: This is such a quality rain jacket for the price. I don’t even want to say they because I worry that Baleaf will realize they’re selling these for waaaay less than they’re worth. Seriously, I’ve owned Columbia, Marmot, North Face, etc. and this rain jacket easily stands up to those traditional big brands in terms of keeping water out, comfort, fit, and looks. Couldn’t be happier with this jacket. Also, I got the blue one, and it’s a really unique, toned-down blue that has gotten compliments already. Royal blue is the worst. This certainly isn’t royal blue.
customer_reviews.author: Keel

customer_reviews.title: Good for outdoor sports
customer_reviews.text: Jacket is very cool. Works well in rain and helps keep out weather. Only complaint the hood is a little big and when you tighten it to keep the rain out of your hair it closes over your eyes. Need to roll it back to see. Still a great jacket for outdoor sports.
customer_reviews.author: K. Ledford

customer_reviews.title: It is nice looking and probably with a long sleeve shirt or ...
customer_reviews.text: The inside gives you the feel that youre wearing plastic. It made me a little uncomfortable feeling my skin kind of stick when they got slightly wet from water. My neck felt uncomfortable when i started to break a bit of a sweat as well. It is nice looking and probably with a long sleeve shirt or a thin hoodie will make it feel a lot better.
customer_reviews.author: VlexVgu

customer_reviews.title: Not sized for American bodies
customer_reviews.text: I bought the large size because I am 5'8 and weigh 175 pounds. the large jacket was so tight on me that it was uncomfortable. most jackets I buy are large and all of them have fit. This one just doesn't work for me
customer_reviews.author: zman365

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: looks good, feels good, sizing perfect. With layered clothing and its lining it should keep a person fairly warm and protected. Light as a windbreaker.
customer_reviews.author: sacerdo primus

customer_reviews.title: It protects you from the rain but...
customer_reviews.text: It's a great Jacket, it protects you from the rain as it says, however is too much suffocating to have this jacket specially if it's a raining day and it's sunny out there. I think this jacket it's better to use in mountains of for jogging, not just for the rain.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Camarena

customer_reviews.title: Water slides right off
customer_reviews.text: If this were a repellent, it's the best in the market. The Bayleaf men's waterproof jacket can be used for walks, runs, cycling, etc. Good quality build inside and the mesh is soft, rather than harsh on the skin. A good way to test out the water repellent factor is to run a small portion of the jacket under the sink/shower.
customer_reviews.author: All Might

customer_reviews.title: Better than an umbrella
customer_reviews.text: Florida afternoon storms are a given. This is very light, easy to pack and I added a small clip to the strap and clip it to my belt. Not too hot when raining and easy to carry around. Just shake off water and fold back into pouch. Pouch keeps it stowed and no wetness leak through. With the wind gusts umbrellas are a pain and you still get wet everywhere. Just wear swim trunks or quick dry cargo shorts and shoes and you are good to go.
customer_reviews.author: Todd F. FAIR, HONEST REVIEWS

customer_reviews.title: Great for concerts
customer_reviews.text: Does what it's supposed to do. I was originally looking for a typical "poncho-style" jacket as we knew that an upcoming concert we were attending was expected to take place on a rainy day. However, for a little bit more money, I saw this and purchased it because it fit more like a typical rain jacket. Received the item very quickly. Good seller. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Elle Leslie

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, yet light weight
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a "cheap" rain jacket that I could keep in my backpack all the time...just in case. i.e., no umbrella Was okay with it potentially being very thin, because I wanted portability. This jacket delivered well above my expectations. It is not "cheap." It is inexpensive, and takes up very little room. Yet, somehow it manages to be one of the highest quality rain jackets I have ever owned!
customer_reviews.author: Jim Goedken

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and it works
customer_reviews.text: Every mountain biker should own one of these! I have used this for summer mountain rain storms and as a wind breaker on the trail. It does trap in your sweat but I would rather be wet and warm over wet and cold. That being said I would never use this backpacking where it is important to stay dry and warm. Great for day hikes and rides!! Fishing trips to the lake or river!! And an emergency jacket to stuff into the truck.
customer_reviews.author: colin williams

customer_reviews.title: Yeah!!! It Woks!
customer_reviews.text: This rain jacket folds into itself although my son has difficulty doing it where it ends up with the zipper on the right side to zip easily but it's roomy and easily covers everything he carries with him and it all stays dry. Although it is the thin type materials it doesn't seem to cling to him when it's pouring rain and it's not heavy or hot which is a great plus as we live in a subtropical area.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: About what i expected
customer_reviews.text: Although you cant argue with the price you do get what you pay for. Its a cheap, not very flexible "waterproof" material. I sweat a LOT when i wear this as its not at all breathable. They use a material you will often find similar to camping tents. It'll shed water fine , but the second you touch the inside of it, water seeps in. This "feature" tends to make wearing it damp. Dont get me wrong, it'll stop 99.9% of water, but you'll get better results with a 0.99$ poncho.
customer_reviews.author: Wood_mage

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a Backpack
customer_reviews.text: This is built well. I bought two raincoats so my husband could choose which one he wants to carry in his hiking backpack. The other coat was more expensive and folded pretty flat but the pocket on this one convinced him that this is the one he would keep. It's perfect for the intended use. Very reasonably priced and good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne Storer

customer_reviews.title: Good but not really perfect
customer_reviews.text: Pro: It does keep you dry from heavy rain mostly. It does fit and adjustable Con: when I said does make you dry mostly but I still got wet from inside my clothes between shoulder and arms. This from work outdoors. Also plus the hood that had arrow between you're forehead it gets really annoying and get in you're way for you're vision because you would keep focusing on that. But you can adjust it if you fold up somehow. Overall it all good I would give 4/5
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed as zipper came broken
customer_reviews.text: Rather dissatisfied. Packs into its own pocket, but zipper missing tab so can’t zip it shut. Also not breathable at all.
customer_reviews.author: Valeriemamoo

customer_reviews.title: Light Weight, but not good for running in rain.
customer_reviews.text: I liked that it was light weight and easy to fold up. What I didn't like was that it is far from water resistant. I ran a half Marathon in a light drizzle and by mile 6 was draining my sleeves of water. I almost took it off and threw it on the side of the road. I would not recommend wearing it while running or any outside activity in the rain. I would have returned it, but the return window is now closed. It doesn't rain around where I live a lot, so I wasn't able to run in the rain with it until now, 4 weeks after purchase.
customer_reviews.author: markymark78

customer_reviews.title: 5'7" at 160lbs Size Medium good price and quality
customer_reviews.text: Love the fit. I'm 5'7" ordered a medium fits good :) jacket is very light and easy to pack when traveling and great for that wind and rain protection I'm gonna be using it for when I jog and ride my Onewheel XR. Love that it packs into itself and has the pull cord on the waist for that tighter fit. I was worried about the sizing and was gonna buy a small but medium fits perfect for my height and weight I'm 160lbs. If I wanted a little more warmth I can easily wear another jacket under it comfortably. For the price and quality I might just buy another for my wife. Thanks Baleaf :)
customer_reviews.author: Henry Aliposa

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I bought the large/xl-my husband and I either one can wear it. He wore it yesterday-very cold and windy and he said it was great( he is on blood thinners. My only problem is I can't figure out how to fold it into the back pocket😂. It does come with a nice zipper and so I am using it.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Ward

customer_reviews.title: Rain proof!
customer_reviews.text: Idk why this has any bad reviews. As a waterproof jacket it’s awesome! I got two sizes bigger just so I could layer jackets underneath. It’s not meant to keep you warm. It’s to keep the water off of you, and definitely does that!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice rain jacket and wind braker
customer_reviews.text: This jacket will indeed protect you from rain and wind but because there is no liner you get soaked from perspiration even on temperatures in the high 40's. Unfortunately there is no ventilation. The fit and style is great.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Don’t pull too hard on the strings
customer_reviews.text: The strings that tighten around the hood broke after my 3rd use so I have to make a knot in order to keep it tight around my head. Aside from that, I love this jacket. It fits over my winter puffer perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Selena

customer_reviews.title: Breathing Needed
customer_reviews.text: Overall this is a good quality jacket, and but I am a pool of sweat after my run with it, even in cooler temps.
customer_reviews.author: Dominic Gadoury

customer_reviews.title: This Is NOT Waterproof!
customer_reviews.text: I wore this in my first half marathon and it rain for almost the entire 13.1 miles and I was soaked after about a mile. If you're looking for something to wear in the rain, this is NOT it. I wish I could return it, but it looks like I had it longer that Amazon will allow returns on this product.
customer_reviews.author: SuccessBookClub

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: The light weight and durable combination is great; however, the water does seem to enter through the sleeves at the wrist. I ran in it on a very rainy day and lives all but the wrist area for keeping water off the body
customer_reviews.author: NLM17

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Only gave it 4-stars because I haven't had a chance to try it out on the links in the rain. Pretty sure it will do the job but also think it maybe a little warm. Time will tell on rain quality and if it's too warm.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Looks good and fits very well
customer_reviews.text: Cool feature about this item is that it is its own bag. You can collapse it into itself which makes it very easy to pack. Also, collapsing it into itself is not a tedious process (I'm looking at YOU unrealistic sleeping bag packing bags...). Have yet to test it in the rain but seems like it would hold out water very well. Hood is also elongated (to the point where you could wear a forward facing baseball hat and it wouldn't get wet). Satisfied with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Cole

customer_reviews.title: Ok for the price
customer_reviews.text: Cheap binding cord ..broke after only a few uses...but its 22.00 ..did not expect a super durable jacket...i use it as a Sauna Jacket while exercising...really holds heat in a makes you sweat ...sticks to you in the rain
customer_reviews.author: B. Green

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for how I’m using it
customer_reviews.text: Amazing jacket perfect fit and if you were looking for an alternative for a sauna suit this jackets pretty good... I take this jacket on my nightly runs with my dog I wear a sweat waist band under the jacket with no shirt and it can get a bit sticky but I don’t really notice it intensifies the sweating a lot and manages to keep warm it’s a nice fit and to test the water resistance I spayed it over with a water hose and I shook the jacket dry the water comes off easily
customer_reviews.author: Manuel

customer_reviews.title: Love everything about it
customer_reviews.text: Love everything about it. There was some little grease spots above the back pocket. I don't know how to directly contact the seller about this. I don't have time for an exchange. Other than that, it's just what my husband needed for our trip to Europe. The whole jacket fits inside the pocket in the back.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Superb Quality
customer_reviews.text: Can be made into a bag no bigger than a little puppy. I took it on a hike in the rainy season here in San Diego and when I took it it off I was completely dry. It works great as a protective top layer when going anywhere wet. Overall, I was very happy with the coat.
customer_reviews.author: French

customer_reviews.title: Good for travel, a little stuffy
customer_reviews.text: The raincoat worked great and was really easy to carry around when not wearing because of the self-storing pocket it has. It’s very easy to get it back into it’s compact form and at that size it can just be clipped onto or stored in a small backpack. My only complaint was that it was a little bit stuffy after wearing for a little bit but not to the point where I couldn’t stand it.
customer_reviews.author: R. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great jacket for the money. Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.text: This jacket was more than I expected. Not only a wind breaker but also rain resistant.
customer_reviews.author: Carol Kobylas

customer_reviews.title: Sweat jacket!
customer_reviews.text: This jacket does not allow proper circulation in it. If I wear it for 10 minutes in the rain... I'm just as soaked with sweat then if I didnt wear it at all. Not a good rain jacket for Hawaii.
customer_reviews.author: King Henry05

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight & Well Designed
customer_reviews.text: The medium size fits true to size. Very well designed waterproof, lightweight jacket with bottom drawstring, foldaway hood, and bonus of two inside pockets! I travel frequently, and this jacket packs well in a suitcase.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Just a pullover
customer_reviews.text: Contrary to the description, this is not a jacket, not a raincoat and not a poncho. It is a pullover with a zipper. Luckily Amazon has an easy return procedure so I could return it.
customer_reviews.author: M. Gallas

customer_reviews.title: Great buy, husband loves it
customer_reviews.text: Great my husband loves it, he is a courier and is constantly getting in and out of van. This allows him the flexibility and keeps him dry. He can wear a thermal underneath and still move around easily.
customer_reviews.author: Gabby

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and easy to throw in a backpack
customer_reviews.text: The rain jacket is probably thinner than I anticipated. It is most useful as an emergency rain jacket you carry with you on rides, hikes or just keep in your car. I haven't tested how waterproof it is yet.
customer_reviews.author: E. Davila

customer_reviews.title: looks great doesnt hold up
customer_reviews.text: much better than buying a poncho and keeps you dry edit: the hood drawstring instantly snapped returned best looking rain suit tho
customer_reviews.author: Jacob

customer_reviews.title: The only good thing about this product is it was super lightweight ...
customer_reviews.text: The back zipper stuck the first day that I used it it kept me dry that's about it no ventilation almost sweated to death. The only good thing about this product is it was super lightweight and did not take up a lot of space.
customer_reviews.author: timothy scott davis

customer_reviews.title: Plastic snapped off when trying it on
customer_reviews.text: First time I put it on and pulled on the string with the plastic thing to close up the hood part, the string snapped. The jacket works and is great for my needs because it’s super thin (for those hot rainy New England days) but I’m surprised it broke on my first use.
customer_reviews.author: Ty4tehreply

customer_reviews.title: Don't look for durabilty
customer_reviews.text: I used the jacket to cover my waders for surf fishing. It wasn't long before the zipper broke. But...you get what you pay for. The jacket was pretty cheep and serving it's purpose. I just can't put anything I don't want to lose in that pocket.
customer_reviews.author: C. Burns

customer_reviews.title: Good design, weakly made
customer_reviews.text: This is a well-designed rain jacket. Pullover with a zipper to close up to the neck. Elastic cuffs and a closer for the hood. BUT, the material is thin although there is a lining for warmth, it too is thin. Hope I'm wrong and it will last for years in my boat storage compartment.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Drawert

customer_reviews.title: Some good points
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be waterproof so far, but also doesn’t let perspiration escape, walking briskly in 35 degree F weather. The fabric is noisy and seems kind of brittle in the cold. The hood is roomy and keeps the wind out.
customer_reviews.author: ditchwitch

customer_reviews.title: Good enough for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Fits well except for the hoodie which I think was made for a giraffe. I did get a small amount of water from the hoodie since I have a normal size neck and head. No ventilation so you can get quite hot in it.
customer_reviews.author: Erik Mathis

customer_reviews.title: Nice light rain jacket.
customer_reviews.text: A bit pricey. But its a really nice rain jacket for the money. Lightweight and easy to fold up and store in my backpack for commuting on my bicycle. Only downside is no ventilation for body heat. Other than that im satisfied with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Randy Spear

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight packable rain jacket with hood, pullover style
customer_reviews.text: This is a pullover style with a partial zipper in front, only down to the breastbone. It squashes down to a very compact bundle that is easy to pack.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Nice Buy!
customer_reviews.text: This jacket fit a bit small but nothing I'm concerned with. Inoive how compact it is. Folds up into its own pocket! I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Brady

customer_reviews.title: I am 5'7 and weigh 165 pounds and the large/xlarge ...
customer_reviews.text: I am 5'7 and weigh 165 pounds and the large/xlarge fit perfectly considering I put it over my other clothes. Even just wearing a t-shirt underneath, it still fits really well for it being considered the larger size.
customer_reviews.author: Namrezy

customer_reviews.title: Not waterproof as advertised!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this jacket because my Canari one was only water “resistant”. Because I have bought your running tights, I thought I would have gotten a good quality “waterproof” jacket for $26. Well I did not! Somehow water still went thru and I was soaked on my 14/16 mile runs. Your tights I LOVE! Price/quality is great, but this jacket was not waterproof enough nor was it worth the $26. It felt like a black trash bag.
customer_reviews.author: Martin Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Keeps you dry, compact storage
customer_reviews.text: Great raincoat for the price. Hood has a hat like bill overhang to keep you dry. Folds up into a little by 5x5 package and zips so you can store in your glove compartment or door pocket.
customer_reviews.author: Zac

customer_reviews.title: Fits Well, Light Weight for Florida, Keeps me Dry
customer_reviews.text: Good quality, good fabric, fits well, I am large...250 lbs. and 6'3" so I got the XX Large. Looks good too.
customer_reviews.author: Cameron H. Chambers

customer_reviews.title: Works. Durable. Lightweight.
customer_reviews.text: Really keeps the water out, and is great for when it's very cold and rainy. It's also highly durable. I went down at about 20mph, slid 15-20 feet, slammed into the curb, and broke my arm bad enough to require surgery. I tore up my bib shorts and leg warmers, but the jacket is fully intact. 10/10 - Would buy again. Surgery is in two days. 👍
customer_reviews.author: IRSnyder

customer_reviews.title: I ordered a jacket, not a tent
customer_reviews.text: The fit on this is just bizaare. I'm a 180 pound man and normally a large fits fine. This large could fit a 300 lb man with room to spare. The hood is ridiculous. It completely hangs down over my face making it impossible to see without holding it with both hands to keep it out of the way. Might as well of just bought a tarp to drap over me. Won't be wearing this
customer_reviews.author: Jeffery D. Neal

customer_reviews.title: Good for travel
customer_reviews.text: Not sure how water proof it is. Bought it for my 13 year old to carry in his backpack to use when needed. Folds up compact in it’s own bag.
customer_reviews.author: 3🌞🌞🌞

customer_reviews.title: Smaller in the midsection then sizing suggests
customer_reviews.text: The jacket is narrow through the midsection. Makes this 2XL jacket more fit for a XL man with no gut (as oppose to a 2X female with a gut and a butt). If it fit me as a men’s 2X in anything else usually does it would have been comfortably oversized for me and pretty good quality. I would say it runs small, but it depends on your shape.
customer_reviews.author: Tia Weedon

customer_reviews.title: Excellent winter wind breaker
customer_reviews.text: I'm a cyclist and use it as a wind breaker during the winter time. It fits perfectly over my winter riding jacket. It also have nice deep pockets for items I need for my ride
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Actually waterproof, bravo
customer_reviews.text: I got a 3x and I’m 5’11 230pds and it is too big but would fit an actual 3x person. Waterproof but hood is weird and tiny
customer_reviews.author: Love Laizure

customer_reviews.title: Otherwise it’s great!
customer_reviews.text: It is truly waterproof! I wore it the first time in the. Nor’Easter we just had and stayed dry. My only regret is that it doesn’t zip all the way down. I bought large to fit over my winter jacket and it’s a little tricky getting on and off, especially since i’m recovering from an arm fracture. Otherwise it’s great!
customer_reviews.author: Gweeney

customer_reviews.title: Meets my expectations!
customer_reviews.text: I like that it is light weight and I can layer clothing underneath it and it keeps me warm that way and dry! Well done people of the company. I like the design 2.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not a fan but they corrected
customer_reviews.text: This jacket is being returned. It's the material of a cheap shower curtain liner and did not fit correctly. Update They have reached out to me and have provided excellent customer service as of now.
customer_reviews.author: stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Keeps you dry when it rain.
customer_reviews.text: Kept me dry all day. The bag in the bag should have some kinda lace so you can zip and un- zip easier. Great jacket still. I recently ordered their undies , really exited to try them too.
customer_reviews.author: vvnrox87

customer_reviews.title: Nice fit
customer_reviews.text: i like the color, the roll up hood is convenient, and there is a handy inside pocket
customer_reviews.author: Philip S. Gilliam

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Jacket!
customer_reviews.text: I love this jacket! Very light and is very comfortable. I wish there was a matching set of pants out of the same material, would be a great combo.
customer_reviews.author: diesel85

customer_reviews.title: Keeps you dry, but....
customer_reviews.text: It works but you have to pull it on over your head. No zipper or buttons. They didn't say that in the description. If I had known, I wouldn't have ordered it.
customer_reviews.author: Mike R

customer_reviews.title: Golf rain jacket
customer_reviews.text: It was exactly what I wanted. A reasonable waterproof jacket for my golf bag. The description said it was waterproof, but that was not on the jacket. Haven't tested it for that yet.
customer_reviews.author: Sue

customer_reviews.title: Love this item
customer_reviews.text: Love this item. It packs into the pocket in the back making it great for keeping in my backpack. It is comfortable and did a great job keeping me dry during a 6 mile hike in the rain. Just what I has hoped for. I will say it is not breathable so in the summer it could get a little warm but for the 40 degree weather we were in it was perfect.
customer_reviews.author: LISA

customer_reviews.title: Great for storms
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight and great. To keep you dry. Hopes it would have been a bit longer but am happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: jim Elder

customer_reviews.title: Blocks rain
customer_reviews.text: Really convenient raincoat for my backpacking trip. It was rainy season, so it came in handy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: GOOD FOR THE OUTDOORS
customer_reviews.text: THIS WAS FOR MY GRANDDAUGHTER WHO IS IN A MARCHING BAND. SHE NEEDED IT DURING PRACTICES. SHE IS TALL AND NEEDED THE MEN'S COAT
customer_reviews.author: watermelongal

customer_reviews.title: Plastic and condensation?
customer_reviews.text: The inside is a plastic that is going to build condensation. It will probably be wet on the inside from that. But I only need a light raincoat for intermittent showers in Costa Rica. I think it will serve.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Collins

customer_reviews.title: Be careful on what size you pick
customer_reviews.text: I have use this in the rain it works it fits perfectly very pleased with my money I spent on it
customer_reviews.author: Nathan O.

customer_reviews.title: Good item...very baggy.
customer_reviews.text: I like the style and it definitely gets the job done just way way baggy.
customer_reviews.author: A. Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Great, light
customer_reviews.text: Great, light, & practical raincoat. It saved me a couple of times on hikes. The coat came folded up, I didn't pay attention to how it was folded. So, if you buy it open it gently and see how it came in. Even though, I do not know how it came in folded so tight and neatly, the coat is still thin and light enough to throw inside a backpack and have sufficient space.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: As long as you are not expecting extremely high quality material, you should be happy with this jacket. It does the job for a $20 jacket. Now all i need to do is figure out how to get all the wrinkles out...
customer_reviews.author: Roosevelt Frank

customer_reviews.title: Seems good for the price
customer_reviews.text: Very thin, lightweight , and packable. I needed it for packing into a suitcase as I am on the road a lot and didn't want to take up much space. Haven't tried it in rain yet
customer_reviews.author: ARDs

customer_reviews.title: Purchased for my daughter who's job requires her to be ...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my daughter who's job requires her to be out in the rain. The product keeps her dry and she likes the adjustable hood. Only complaint is that it doesn't breath well, but we live in central Florida so it's typically extremely muggy during/after our daily storms.
customer_reviews.author: Lucy

customer_reviews.title: Not worth 20 bucks
customer_reviews.text: It’s a very cheap jacket I wouldn’t pay over $19 for this jacket they raise the price online but it’s not worth 19 bucks
customer_reviews.author: altecz44

customer_reviews.title: Good basic and cheap
customer_reviews.text: Good basic packable rain jacket. Fold up nice and small. Very waterproof. Not breathable but I didn't want something that will let water soak through.
customer_reviews.author: A. Daniel Yavuzkurt

customer_reviews.title: Super thin!
customer_reviews.text: It was way thinner than I expected, it was basically like wearing a garbage bag.
customer_reviews.author: KL

customer_reviews.title: Keep the rain out and sweat in the process.
customer_reviews.text: I love this jacket. Super light. A little baggy. Make you sweat like crazy especially if you work in them.
customer_reviews.author: Sarpush

customer_reviews.title: Fits great
customer_reviews.text: It kind of does look a bit like a trash bag, but it does the job and folds wonderfully. Its a great jacket for rain and wind
customer_reviews.author: Christa

customer_reviews.title: Overall decent product
customer_reviews.text: Good products. Overall would recommend. Could be a bit thicker seems very thin and would be prone to ripping. Also the pouch is on the back which seems odd. But it works great for what I wanted.
customer_reviews.author: Kendall H.

customer_reviews.title: like
customer_reviews.text: great jacket wish it had zipper all the way down instead of just about a third of the way making it a pull over
customer_reviews.author: Clayton Nichols

customer_reviews.title: Great little jacket
customer_reviews.text: I got this specifically for a trip to Washington state, where it is quite rainy. It worked well in repelling water. The only reason I give this 4 stars is because it lacks front pockets. I really feel front pockets should be made for this.
customer_reviews.author: Craig N. Heon

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome lightweight rain jacket for running! It folds into a small packet that zips into itself. An awesome buy!
customer_reviews.author: Michael n

customer_reviews.title: Pfft
customer_reviews.text: Essentially, this is a thick plastic bag with sleeves sewn onto it. It's a decent $12 bit of one-season use rain gear. For this price, it's arrogantly overpriced.
customer_reviews.author: AcuPaul

product_meta.title: BALEAF Men's Rain Jacket Waterproof with Hooded Lightweight Packable Cycling Pullover Running Raincoat Poncho Windbreaker
feature_bullets: Drawstring with adjustable hem and Elastic cuffs help to keep clothes dry. Relaxed fit
Two side zipper pocket and one 7-inch wide back pocket for storage, packable back pocket no need bag to pack.
Three reflective logos provide high visibility in low light during rains
After receiving the product, if you have any questions, please contact Baleaf through Amazon immediately. Baleaf is committed to providing a good shopping experience and you can buy with confidence
